item.description:
“We Have Moxie”
Saturday, March 27, 2010
At the Millyard Museum
10:30 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
FREE Manchester Historic Association members; $10 general public (includes museum admission)
Please RSVP

With a special appearance of a full-sized reproduction Moxie "Horse Car" in the 200 Bedford Street parking lot!

This entertaining talk by Merrill Lewis, highlights the rich history and recent resurgence of New Hampshire’s own distinctively different "tonic." This year marks Moxie’s 125th anniversary as America’s oldest brand of continuously produced bottled soda. Also featured is the ongoing saga of the fabled Moxie Bottle House, once a Manchester landmark located near Grenier Field (now the Manchester-Boston Regional Airport), as well as the influence of Moxie during the World War II era. Mr. Lewis is President of the New England Moxie Congress.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a nametag.
item.name: "We have Moxie"
